channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Can Bellingham make El Clasico statement with English sub-plot?
item.description: As Jude Bellingham prepares to face England team-mate Marcus Rashford in El Clasico, BBC Sport looks at why it could be a defining match for the Real Madrid midfielder.

item.title: 'They're in trouble' - West Ham make worst start in 52 years
item.description: West Ham's miserable Premier League campaign continues with a defeat at Leeds on Friday which ensured their worst start to a season for 52 years.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v The Charlatans guitarist Mark Collins
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on The Charlatans guitarist Mark Collins with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Chelsea's James on love of fashion & friendship with Hamilton
item.description: Reece James has progressed from the Chelsea academy to club captain, overcoming a number of injuries along the way.

item.title: Leeds earn big win to heap more misery on West Ham
item.description: Leeds secure their first Premier League win at home since their opening game in August and pile on the problems for second-bottom West Ham.

item.title: NI return 'always in the back of my mind' - McFadden
item.description: Northern Ireland defender Sarah McFadden tells BBC Sport NI of her "long journey" to returning to play for her country, six months after giving birth to her second child.

item.title: 'Not pretty or nice but Scotland come up clutch in Casablanca'
item.description: Scotland's first victory in almost a year wasn't "pretty or nice," says midfielder Erin Cuthbert, but it shows the national team can "come up clutch" in the testing moments.

item.title: 'Bitter-sweet day' - but what next for Sheff Wed after administration?
item.description: Manager Henrik Pedersen calls for a "new Sheffield Wednesday with an old heart" as a fan group contemplates a potential takeover.

item.title: 'Nearly old enough to be my dad' - James salutes Silva
item.description: Chelsea captain Reece James tells Kelly Somers how Thiago Silva has influenced his career as he sits down for The Football Interview.

item.title: West Ham aren't doing basic things - Nuno
item.description: West Ham head coach Nuno Espirito Santo expresses his disappointment after a 2-1 loss at Leeds, and says his side "aren't doing basic things".

item.title: Weir wonder strike hands Scotland win in Morocco
item.description: Watch Caroline Weir's stunning 90th-minute strike as Scotland beat Morocco 2-1 in their friendly in Casablanca to end an eight-game run without a victory.

item.title: Farke praises 'aggressive, brave performance' from Leeds
item.description: Manager Daniel Farke praises Leeds after a "hard-fought" 2-1 win over a struggling West Ham, highlighting his side's "aggressive and brave performance".

item.title: 'Moment of magic' - Grull scores stunner for Werder Bremen
item.description: Marco Grull scores a stunning second-half strike as Werder Bremen beat Union Berlin in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Chelsea & Liverpool want Upamecano - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Chelsea face competition from Liverpool for Dayot Upamecano, Manchester United are confident of £50m deal for Morten Hjulmand, and Real Madrid are ready to pay big money for Kenan Yildiz.

item.title: NI 'still in tie' despite first-leg loss - Oxtoby
item.description: Northern Ireland manager Tanya Oxtoby says her side are "still in the tie" despite being defeated 2-0 in the home leg of their Nations League promotion/relegation playoff against Iceland.

item.title: I have not agreed to leave Man Utd - Fernandes
item.description: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes says he will not discuss his future with anyone until after the World Cup.

item.title: Vote for your BBC Women's Footballer of the Year
item.description: Voting for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award is now open.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Caldentey
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and Spain midfielder Mariona Caldentey, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Hampton
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Chelsea and England goalkeeper Hannah Hampton, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Bonmati
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Aitana Bonmati, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Russo
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Arsenal and England forward Alessia Russo, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: Women's Footballer of the Year contender Guijarro
item.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Patri Guijarro, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2025 award.

item.title: 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year contenders
item.description: Meet the five contenders who have been nominated for the 2025 BBC Women's Footballer of the Year award.

item.title: Why it's time for big-game Gordon to deliver in Premier League
item.description: Anthony Gordon has impressed in the Champions League this season, but the Newcastle United forward has yet to score or assist in the Premier League.

item.title: Salah form 'last thing' Slot worries about - plus surprise stats on his season
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "the last thing" he needs to worry about is Mohamed Salah returning to form.

item.title: Carter-Vickers could be out until March - what does it mean for Celtic?
item.description: Celtic defender Cameron Carter-Vickers could be out until March with an Achilles injury, manager Brendan Rodgers reveals.

item.title: Why are last season's relegated trio struggling in the Championship?
item.description: Leicester City, Ipswich Town and Southampton have just nine wins between them after 11 rounds of the 2025-26 Championship season.

item.title: Fishlock 'at top' of list of Welsh sport's greats
item.description: Wales will bid farewell to Jess Fishlock this weekend with captain Angharad James believing the midfielder sits "at the top" of the list of the nation's sporting greats.

item.title: Confidence, momentum, belief - can rampant Coventry keep it up?
item.description: Are Frank Lampard's Coventry City finally on their way back to the Premier League, even with 35 games remaining?

item.title: England keeper debut due with Hampton out injured
item.description: Goalkeeper Hannah Hampton will miss England's friendly against Brazil on Saturday because of injury.

item.title: Sheffield Wednesday given 12-point deduction after entering administration
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday have been placed in administration and hit with an automatic 12-point deduction by the EFL.

item.title: Can you name the line-ups from Chelsea 5-1 Sunderland in 2017?
item.description: Chelsea and Sunderland meet on Saturday, but can you name the line-ups from Chelsea's 5-1 win in 2017?

item.title: 'A lot of things in their favour' - why Hearts could win title
item.description: Hearts could move eight points clear of Celtic in the Scottish Premiership on Sunday - but how likely is a title win?

item.title: Tynecastle showdown, eyes on Rohl & Kildje in focus
item.description: A top-of-the-table clash, Danny Rohl's Ibrox bow and a certain Hibernian striker are BBC Scotland's weekend Premiership picks.

item.title: EFL players left 'numb' by increase in online abuse
item.description: EFL director of equality, diversity and inclusion David McArdle says social media platforms must play their part in helping to tackle online abuse.

item.title: 'I can take my kids again' - Sheff Wed fan reacts to administration
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday fan Gaz Robinson says he is happy the club is in administration and he will start to take his kids to matches again.

item.title: 'Take it in and put it in the memory' - Dyche on first Forest game
item.description: Sean Dyche reflects on an opening win as Nottingham Forest manager, as they beat Porto 2-0 in the Europa League.

item.title: A sad situation but it can still be a good day - Pedersen
item.description: Sheffield Wednesday manager Henrik Pedersen says going into administration is a "tough day" but he can see a bright future still for the Championship club.

item.title: Brilliant Grull goal earns Bremen back-to-back home victories
item.description: Marco Grull's "moment of magic" secures Werder Bremen a 1-0 victory against Union Berlin in the Bundesliga.

item.title: Celtic 'not quite a Ferrari but a Range Rover Sport'
item.description: Manager Brendan Rodgers is pleased with the way his Celtic players bounced back from their defeat at Dundee, with victory over Sturm Graz.

item.title: 'Red flags for Rohl as Rangers routed in first game'
item.description: In the last few seasons, Rangers went toe-to-toe with Athletic Bilbao, Benfica, Red Bull Leipzig and Borussia Dortmund. Now they're getting routed by Brann.

item.title: Rashford wants to stay at Barcelona when loan ends
item.description: Marcus Rashford hopes he can stay at Barcelona when his loan agreement from Manchester United ends in the summer.

item.title: Can Arsenal's defence lead them to title glory?
item.description: Arsenal spent big in the summer to try to improve their attack, but it might be their defence that could end up winning them a first Premier League title in 22 years.

item.title: What does it mean when a club enters administration?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at what it means when a club enters administration.

item.title: 'I admit I cried' - Hermoso's joy at Spain recall
item.description: Jenni Hermoso says she "cried" after being recalled to the Spain squad by new manager Sonia Bermudez following a year-long absence.

item.title: Wolves boss Pereira fined £15,000 for kicking ball in frustration
item.description: Wolves head coach Vitor Pereira is fined £15,000 for an incident of misconduct during the club's Premier League draw against Brighton on 5 October.

item.title: Benitez joins 15th club of career as Panathinaikos boss
item.description: Former Liverpool manager Rafael Benitez has been appointed head coach of Greek side Panathinaikos, the 15th club of his managerial career.

item.title: Slot reveals Isak fitness worry
item.description: Liverpool boss Arne Slot reveals he withdrew Alexander Isak at half-time against Eintracht Frankfurt because the striker had felt discomfort in his groin.

item.title: Why are the top strikers scoring more goals in modern football?
item.description: Champions League pundit Guillem Balague believes with more teams playing man-to-man marking strikers in modern football are awarded more space to score goals and are also being given "individualised coaching" about how to exploit those spaces.

item.title: Basketball is my number one - Gvardiol
item.description: Manchester City's Josko Gvardiol shares his love of basketball and how he almost swapped football for it when he was younger.

item.title: I know what it takes in the Premier League - Dyche
item.description: Sean Dyche says he "takes great pride" in becoming Nottingham Forest's new manager and "knows what it takes" to succeed in the Premier League.

item.title: 'Phenomenal' Gyokeres makes Arsenal better team - Arteta
item.description: Mikel Arteta says striker Viktor Gyokeres makes Arsenal a better team after the striker ended a lean spell with two goals against Atletico Madrid in the Champions League.

item.title: Brentford dominate West Ham to earn first away win of season
item.description: Brentford earn their first Premier League away win of the season to ruin Nuno Espirito Santo's first home game in charge of struggling West Ham.

item.title: Fishlock's fab four - pick your favourite goal
item.description: As Jess Fishlock prepares to face Australia on Saturday in her final international, choose the best goal from these four stunners.

item.title: 'Being gay didn't feel normal, until I became a footballer'
item.description: Manchester City's Kerstin Casparij always knew she "fancied girls" but did not see LGBTQ+ representation until playing professional football.

item.title: Meet the Sunday league team with 1,800 Premier League appearances
item.description: How do you improve a stellar veteran team who have won back-to-back titles? Recruit a raft of former Premier League and international stars.

item.title: Kane can't stop scoring - is the Ballon d'Or within reach?
item.description: With 23 goals in 15 games for Bayern Munich and England this season, Harry Kane is emerging as an early frontrunner for the 2026 Ballon d'Or.

item.title: Is Dyche the right man to repair Forest?
item.description: Sean Dyche answers an SOS call from Nottingham Forest as the club look to restore confidence - is he the right man for the job?

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: What is the Premier League multi-ball system?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the rules of the Premier League multi-ball system and what happened in Liverpool's defeat against Manchester United.

item.title: When is the 2027 Women's World Cup qualification draw?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains when the 2027 Women's World Cup European qualification draw takes place and how it works?

item.title: When did a non-Old Firm team last win a Scottish title?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the last time a team other than Rangers or Celtic won Scottish football's top flight division.

item.title: How did internet outage affect West Ham v Brentford?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why the Amazon Web Services global outage affected Brentford's win over West Ham

item.title: What is the manager VAR card being trialled by Fifa?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything Team look at how the Football Video Support system works.

item.title: What does squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean in football?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain what squad-cost ratio and anchoring mean.

item.title: England are going to the 2026 World Cup - who else has qualified?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who has qualified for next year's Fifa World Cup.

item.title: Rangers 'didn't screw up' head coach appointment
item.description: Chairman Andrew Cavenagh insists Rangers did not "screw up" the process to appoint head coach Danny Rohl but admits it looked "clunky" from the outside.

item.title: What did we learn from Rohl's Rangers unveiling?
item.description: Danny Rohl understands the need to win quickly as Rangers head coach and says he can handle pressure, as chief executive Patrick Stewart and sporting director Kevin Thelwell come under fire.

item.title: Winning & togetherness - Rohl sets out Rangers mission
item.description: Danny Rohl delivers a simple message as he is introduced as Rangers head coach, stating: "We want to win."

item.title: 'Rohl jumps from Wednesday frying pan into Rangers furnace'
item.description: Danny Rohl has taken on one of the toughest managerial jobs in world football by succeeding Russell Martin at Rangers, writes Tom English.

item.title: 'A proud club dragged into gutter'
item.description: Kevin Muscat is the latest to be ruled out of Rangers' manager search - so what do fans make of the process, and who do they want now?

item.title: Standard-Antwerp abandoned after cup hits referee
item.description: Standard Liege's match against Royal Antwerp will be concluded on Monday behind closed doors after being abandoned in the 87th minute.

item.title: 'With service, Hojlund is a 25-goals-a-year striker'
item.description: Peter Schmeichel criticises the decision-making at Manchester United that has allowed Rasmus Hojlund to follow Scott McTominay to Napoli.

item.title: Agyemang joins Premier League stars on Golden award shortlists
item.description: England striker Michelle Agyemang is nominated for Golden Girl, while nine Premier League players are named on the shortlist for the Golden Boy award.

item.title: Top European clubs discuss using six substitutes
item.description: Europe's top clubs, including some Premier League sides, have held discussions about using six substitutes per game to ease the workload on players.

item.title: Overseas game a 'sacrifice' for 'survival' of Serie A - Como
item.description: Italian club Como say "sacrifice is essential" to ensure the "survival" of Serie A amid the financial dominance of the Premier League as they press ahead with plans to play AC Milan in Perth, Australia.

item.title: Three players, 57 goals - who is the best striker?
item.description: BBC Sport looks at the goalscoring exploits of Harry Kane, Kylian Mbappe and Erling Haaland, who are all averaging more than a goal a game.

item.title: How much do you know about England's rivalry with Brazil?
item.description: With England facing Brazil in Manchester on Saturday, we wanted to challenge you with this Lionesses quiz.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: How does Daniel Levy run Tottenham - and would he ever leave?
item.description: With Tottenham struggling on the pitch and chairman Daniel Levy facing criticism from fans, BBC Sport looks at how the club is run and what the future might hold.

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.

item.title: The rise and fall of North Korea - the sleeping giant of women's football
item.description: North Korea lags behind most of the rest of the world in several areas. But the hermit state has had an outsized impact on international women's football.
